title: 820-4924 Fully functional but power button doesn't work on battery only
message: This one is baffling me. Everything works normally. Not liquid-damaged. Computer works fine on battery. Power button works fine with adapter plugged in. But the power button will not do anything with only the battery connected. Tried known good battery and keyboard. No change. Installed working board and everything is normal. Any ideas?

title: 820-4924 Fully functional but power button doesn't work on battery only
message: Voltage on SMCONOFF with and without charger? I would still suspect corrosion under SMC though.

title: 820-4924 Fully functional but power button doesn't work on battery only
message: 3.4V on SMC_ONOFF_L in all scenarios - battery only, no battery, charger with battery. Power button will actually turn off computer with battery-only but it will not turn it on. Turns on and off fine with charger. There is no sign at all of spill-damage but I did just notice that the SPI looks like it was messed with. Not sure if that might have changed things and could be causing this. Or maybe something in the surrounding area was affected when the SPI was removed and resoldered.

title: 820-4924 Fully functional but power button doesn't work on battery only
message: I suspect crap under the SMC, inspect for liquid damage.
